content.text:
# 2016 British Academy Television Awards

The 2016 British Academy Television Awards were held on 8 May 2016.
The nominations were announced on 30 March, with Wolf Hall nominated for four awards.
Winners and nominees
, Best Actor winner]]
, Best Supporting Actor winner]]
, Best Male Comedy Performance winner]]
, Best Female Comedy Performance winner for Michaela Coel and Best Scripted Comedy nominee]]
{| class=wikitable
|-
! style="background:#BDB76B; width: 50%" | Best Actor
! style="background:#BDB76B; width: 50%" | Best Actress
|-

*'Mark Rylance – Wolf Hall as Thomas Cromwell (BBC Two)'
**Ben Whishaw – London Spy as Daniel "Danny" Edward Holt (BBC Two)
**Idris Elba – Luther as DCI John Luther (BBC One)
**Stephen Graham – ''This Is England '90 as Andrew "Combo" Gascoigne (Channel 4)
| valign="top" |

**Claire Foy – Wolf Hall as Anne Boleyn (BBC Two)
**Ruth Madeley – Don’t Take My Baby as Anna Watson (BBC Three)
**Sheridan Smith – The C-Word as Lisa Lynch (BBC One)
|-
! style="background:#BDB76B;" | Best Supporting Actor

|-
| valign="top" |
